6VTEyN-jRL1Y3NCayN8Xgg.text: We LOVE the atmosphere of bradshaws! The detail and craftiness of the interior is amazing!!! They have a decent selection of beer, would love to see more local crafts! We will be back! :)

yGax36b6GMk8213gCQ8nTA.text: I'm a native to the Ballantyne, Stonecrest and Blakeney area as decided to get a group of friends together for drinks last night. My group was late 20's early 30's, diverse, classy and well connected within the community. We showed up at about 9ish and the placed was rather crowded, found a table close to the bar by a Pillar and began to wait on drinks. We were met by a New Castle beer rep Shannon first which was, in complete honesty, much nicer than our waitress who took 30 minute before getting to us. She also immediately scolded the New Castle beer rep publicly for handing us free full-size samples since she won't be getting a tip for that. As more of my group began to show, the bouncers said we were too big and needed us to squeeze in as to not interrupt the wait staff from getting to their tables. Okay, I understand but the problem wasn't our group size, it was their location of the table we selected. If they properly placed tables, we wouldn't have blocked their staff. It is completely unacceptable to approach new customers in such a way as a new business in the area. We were hustled additionally 2 to 3 times to squeeze before I had to explain to the bouncer this is getting ridiculous, speaking to brand new customers like this..... Our waitress was slow, completely disoriented and really upset about having to remember our entire groups drink orders. I would suggest they invest in new staff training for larger customer groups. She was also clearly complaining to others on staff, enough that our entire group could tell and became uncomfortable, which is terrible for a business.  I want to be clear, I was embarrassed after gathering my friends to come out to this establishment and to be treated to way we were. My Review is solely based on service as that was my primary take away from the experience.

tXeGd66qU1HaAG1RzGrF9g.text: Poor service & bad food. Wings were nasty, barely a drop of sauce on them and this is the 2nd time I've been there where they didn't have the beer that was on the menu. Definitely black-listed.

-xj07JK502F8t02lLw3qoA.text: Cool atmosphere but way too much going on behind the scenes. Failed health inspection, drugs constantly being found in bathrooms, and way too many people drinking underage there. The employees dont seem to care as long as they get tips. ALE has been there numerous times so be weary of when you are leaving the parking lot if you are intoxicated. Food is borderline disgusting, as I noticed my marinara sauce was cold and the steak tips were dangerously undercooked. Overall a trashy bar that was cool when it opened. Now it's full of rich white kids and their moms who hit on the kids friends. Check out char bar or hickory tavern. Won't be back.

mVlCEWjUXOS4CD-pHN81eQ.text: DEFINITELY Cougarville, but it's kind of fun to watch. I only go when I'm with my wife and use her as a shield to avoid them. Decent....what you'd expect bar food. Wings are perhaps a little better than average bar wings.  Nice decor/ambience, especially with the large garage door open on a nice day. Bar wraps around the perimeter and I like to sit on the side looking out  the big windows. Friendly and sweet girls behind the bar.

7BFVLxRBKRNtOOSQIK2p_Q.text: Great place to hang out. Best draft selection around. Great menu and philly cheese steak is off the chain.

5YPZ7G6qfQhJEWKNiGcMUQ.text: Went here with my husband and another couple on a Friday evening. We sat at a top table in the very crowded bar area. Service was pretty slow because they were very busy. We did not like people standing around our table.  While we were there someone decided to raise the garage door type doors that opens one side of the bar up to the outside. This will be a nice feature when it is cooler outside but not when it is 95 degrees outside.  Immediately the entire place became so hot. We all had 1 drink and an appetizer then left.  Just a little too crowded, loud and hot for what we wanted that evening.  We will try this place again but definitely request a booth. Hoping to see this place do well.

pJjnW5FuDQPROeWAnkv7-w.text: Nice beer specials, good service, nice atmosphere. It's a cool bar. I went during an off peak time. Middle of the day during work hours so it was quiet. I'll be going back during a Friday night to check out the real social scene

jItrKMCIPIGDDOaLCCZobg.text: My husband and I tried Bradshaw's on a Saturday afternoon and were pleasantly surprised considering the reviews. We sat at the bar which had a great industrial feel- really our style. The crowd was definitely more men than women but makes sense as it has a sports bar feel. I have no problem with it has I enjoy watching sports. Prices seemed reasonable for beers and good daily specials. I had wings which were pretty good and really enjoyed their fries. My husband had the French dip which was delicious! The only thing was our bartender seemed a little absent but then again she had a large bar to deal with. All in all it was good experience and we can't wait to come check out the live music.

T3ebqO5AN_OzBuDIeGw9Jg.text: I love it!  It's a perfect fir for the area.  We really needed a nice, casual tavern, which is neither a sterile restaurant nor a grimy bar.  The name suits it...social house.  The food amzingly complements the atmosphere, and the decor with the open air feel bring it all together.  Great job guys, I'll see you there regularly.

6lSRYeoA4G-FW10949sNnA.text: I was here last night for the last of a handful of times. It is not a big place, and on any given night it is pretty cluttered with tables. On Saturday, they not only have a cluttered, difficult-to-navigate bar, but then they add a band to the small space that they have, making it impossible to walk around, talk to anyone, or even order food or drinks because it's so loud. After a 20minute attempt to walk around the bar, we decided to just go out to the patio. We sat at an empty table and asked for menus. The girl brought them promptly back where we sat for nearly 20minutes with empty glasses and no one had come to find out what we wanted. The girl who brought us the menus sat, all the while, at the table next to us flirting with a pair of guys. It wasn't until we LITERALLY flagged someone down, that we finally got someone to take our order. We were told that management apparently leaves at 10 and the head bartender takes over controlling the restaurant after that. Well, they don't do a good job. She only made the excuse that "oh, it's not her section, someone else should have helped you." That wasn't our problem. We ordered 2 appetizers, which came out quickly and tasted good, but still had to flag down the same girl every time we needed anything. I'm extremely dissatisfied with this bar, having never had a "great" experience to begin with. I won't be returning.

iAdsrf5WHZRCnoEzSDcDAA.text: Great selection of beer and liquor. Although I do not eat, food looked and smelled amazing! Friendly staff who go out of there way to please customer.

_uw33ikFJ7RVT-IeDb__bg.text: First and for most the beer cheese is amazing, which is why I keep coming back. The night life is awesome the music is a little too loud to even think by what do you expect it's a bar.  But let's talk about service here: A) there is no professionalism in the slightest... B) Almost all the servers and bartenders look like they had one to many last night and need sleep. C) My empty water cup sat there for a good 10 min while the bartender and server are hanging it with their friends bouncing a ball around gossiping and texting away on their phones. I get its 3 in the afternoon and the lunch rush has already come through, but please do your job before getting on your phone. No one checked on my friend and I to see if the food was good or if I needed anything else.

TuyKIAmLBr6JPPnT2UzU5A.text: The wait staff needs an attitude adjustment. Hardly friendly or attentive. As if we were a bother. And all we needed was bottled beer. Hate to think what would happen if I ordered an app.

KM9oEPJbyaByH1dGh59r9A.text: I'm always an advocate for local owners to do well but this place has a long way to go. One immediate turnoff was all of the cigarette smoking directly outside of the opened garage style doors that led to the inside of the joint. All of that secondhand smoke was just foul, and the worst part was watching the owner out there supporting it. The next issue I has was with the number of beers not available that evening. There were six beers that were on the menu, yet not available. As for the menu...it's typical bar food. That said, who pays $12 for wings?? The prices in this place are high. I'm not sure why the owner wouldn't have the insight to realize that when your appetizers (aka "shared plates") are the same price as your meals....they're too expensive!  I paid $9 for a plate of potato chips sprinkled with bleu cheese and bacon pieces. Nothing kept the toppings on the chips, so all I was doing was eating a plate of over-priced chips and spooning up the cheese and bacon. A bit of a loser, friends.

M2F2hivKu40rkBXvQMc6ow.text: Wings are awesome!! Staff is friendly and always have great entertainment. . Trivia was also the of fun with 1/2 price Wings on Tuesdays and weekends are fun With live music!!  Definitely love bradshaws!

2FIaU8P5TWXrF8W-dvu51Q.text: Everything is really good!!!  I am amazed every time I eat there. Fast friendly service and consistent food quality.  I highly recommend the ribeye stack sammy with fries.  Lots of great beers but I love the cucumber vodka mixed drink!

PTxD7tYwF6s96tr4ArV0Rw.text: This place is awesome!  Great food - friendly staff - awesome atmosphere!  Love the indoor/outdoor feel with the garage doors and the set up is great!  Great for families or friends for late night!  Love the weekly live music!  South Charlotte needed a place like this!!  Try the Cajun burger or the Asian shrimp salad - yum!

do-EUrb756Zfq_GlmQdeBQ.text: Went to Bradshaw today and it was pretty good. I had the Barb-B-Cuban and it was really good combination.  My daughter and wife's salad were a little heavy with dressing but good.  The other daughter enjoyed the fried chicken. I would go back....

4h9xeco2qbapBfBtL0ez4A.text: This review was originally posted 6/29/2013 but was somehow removed: Went early on a Tuesday night and felt like I was prepared for a casual bar type atmosphere with quality food.  Staff was very friendly and attentive, from the hostess to the waitress.  Cool design, however it becomes very loud as the entire place is made of concrete, metal, and stone.  Huge bar but a surprisingly small list of "house" drinks.  Now for the bad.  Order the shrimp quesadilla which had a few large shrimp with a very dry cheese, peppers, and onions. The filling was ok but should have used some kind of a "melty" cheese.  The problem was that instead of using a soft flour type of tortilla they used a hard shell type of tortilla.  Not good at all.  My wife had the spinach salad which was ok but the spinach wilted rapidly and the dressing was really thin.  The biggest problem was the "deluxe burger" for $13 I was expecting a juicy decent sized burger with bacon and cheese.  The roll was excellent however despite ordering my burger medium it came out very well which was strange as it had no sign of it being on a grill or flat top.  Just cool and grey.  Originally they brought out the burger with only a piece of lettuce on it and nothing else.  I told them it was not what I ordered and they brought back the same burger with just a squirt of mayo on it and lettuce.  Again I explained this is not what I ordered.  She brought back the same burger with a tiny piece of unmelted hard cheese and some sort of chopped up bacon topping.  They should have at least offered to make a new burger vs carrying the same cold overcooked burger back and forth three times.  It was maybe a quarter of an inch thick and clearly was not hand made.  School lunch burger on a great roll. I hope they figure it out but I doubt we will be back.

FB8ANsEUDixNDxqMXx-wJQ.text: Fun events like trivia night and a good selection of local beers on tap. It's nice to have a friendly local bar.

szqvLu9xML_L-XzKHzemag.text: Great atmosphere,  very good menu, excellent service,  and lots of beers to choose from. The only thing about this place is the parking.    If you want a quiet place this isn't it. It's called a social house for a reason.  Go for the food, the drinks, and the crowd.  Plenty of TVs to catch a game.   Enjoy!

ms35L_pPLvAwHVlqcFHJmw.text: We planed go to Cosmo next door for food.  It was closed for renovation.  So we walked over to see they have burglars.  I've a cheese burglar & a beer.  Burgers starts from $8 & beer from $4.  I love sweet potatoes.  So I switched to sweet potato.  A beer is a beer.  Both burglar & fries were very good to me. It's a bit noisy due to wall TVs & young people excitement.  Overall it's not bad.  Hahaha!  My friend checked that if a typing error on burgers.  Sorry for that!  My eye sight wasn't too good!

GpQjdoH1FmnBXaqJcRpXxw.text: This is an AWSOME place to come and relax with great food and great drinks.  Came to Charlotte for a couple days and I went here both nights.  Great live band on a Thursday, packed with 30 somethings having a great time.

E5XhfxHbc6HSlTl9zFHs3w.text: 10 months from my original review.  Yes they have great beer selections.  NO they are not in stock (I'm not kidding - I went through 7 beer requests, only 4 were available and subpar - but more on that later). Plenty of TVs but almost all are playing the exact same thing.  Great cover bands - would love to see them anywhere else but here.  The food is still Eh. It's still Cougartown.  Still can't get a seat after 9pm.  Here's something new- my waitress to the shared table (thanks nice ladies for letting us sit with you) is a monster bitch with pupils the size of saucers and claims the beers are the same if made by the same brewery. When the heck is a Abbey Ale the same as an IPA? And why would would ask that I got 2 of them before realizing something was wrong?? Because the first few beers I asked for were drafts and the lines are dirty - which changes the flavor and makes everything sour. When I brought this to her attention, she gave me an attitude. Look sweetie, I get you're working hard to have your tables not to the bar but if you were more attentive and available to order from people would actually use your service.  Moving right along, since she was no help I went to the bar where a very nice bartender basically agreed the beer lines are dirty and that's the end of that. Fine - on to the manager. Nope not one of staff. But I did get to speak to a VERY Young looking "owner" who apologized for his staff being rude and asked what he could BUY ME after I explained 7 beers, only a few actually in stock and the drafts were nasty.  I don't want free stuff - I want a good tasting beer!!!! 3 attempts at this bar near my home and it's it. Not going back. I can find better beer and nicer service near my home elsewhere.  2 stars for the 2 bartenders who have tried to be helpful and apologetic who can't fix the problem but were nice, attentive and professional.

76XRanr_Xhlhf_ipTbS14g.text: I like the place but I'm afraid to go back in a way which is sad. I used to go to that area a lot to salsa dance at Cosmos bc I am a professional dancer and instructor but Cosmos has long since closed down. The bouncers at Bradshaws were really nice and professional and so were the bartenders. However, I don't like to go to places where people try to start trouble with me for no reason. I went here last night to meet a friend and we were at the bar. One of the bartenders had her back turned towards us as she was performing her closing duties and counting money and so I politely said "excuse me miss, can we order some drinks from you, well whenever you're done doing that bc I see your counting money so take your time." The bartender said "sure!" She finished that part of her duties and made us drinks and I thought all was good. However, a few mins later a guy comes right behind me and asks me how I got the bartender's attention. He asked me if I said "excuse me miss or excuse me bitch" smh, i immediately thought he was joking bc it just sounded funny, "excuse me..bitch? Can we order drinks from you..." so I laughed and made a DMX reference that I got from Kat Williams which is kind of popular like "I'm Rick James bitch" from the Chappelle Show. Little did I realize this guy was serious and was the bartender's bf and was trying to pick a fight with me in front of his friends to show he was tough or something. I get it, he was trying to defend her honor bc he thought I said "excuse me bitch" but the bouncer vouched for me and told him that I'm not the kind of guy that would say anything like that and his girlfriend even told him that I was very respectful in how I spoke to her and apologized to me. Yet this guy was still giving me evil looks and not trying to let it go. I was trying to appeal to his common sense like who says "excuse me bitch" to a bartender and expects to get service after that not to mention "excuse me bitch, can we order some drinks from you, well whenever you're done doing that bc I see you're counting money right now so take your time." Smh lol..But this guy was really trying to be tough and didn't want to apologize for misunderstanding or anything. All I could think of was what happened in Greece recently, where I grew up where an African American from the USA was beaten to death for talking to a white bartender there and my guard was up and I was wondering if he and his friends were trying to do the same thing so I was thinking about trying to get to the trunk of my car in order to protect myself if need be. But yeah, I like the place but I'm guessing since he is her bf, he will be there a lot and I don't want to be places where there are people of that nature trying to start something with me for being polite and respectful and I end up getting hurt or hurting someone else bc I'm too old for that kind of drama. I've been telling my coworkers and students and friends about this incident and they are saying they don't want to ever go there now which is very unfortunate. But the bouncer that was there trying to diffuse the situation is the real MVP and I appreciate and commend him greatly.

l2AehWfwPB9Db8w6o3f3TQ.text: This is the worse night I've ever had! I came to the bar with the intention to have a great night and was rudely surprised by the atmosphere and bartender/ so called manager Tabitha. Not only was the Cucumber Martini the worse I've ever had - tasting like pure rubbing alcohol, the girl who served it was the nastiest person I've ever met! Not once was I checked on as I sat here for over an hour. I was given food with no offer of water to go along with it. After my bill was given to me and I expressed my concern - although my drank sat at the bar untouched for the entire hour - only then was it taken off my bill. Hate to say it but 2 thumbs down from.

Q7crEEA_JChWOSeZX25xMQ.text: Went there last night (Saturday night) for a few beers. Got a table that seats 6 comfortably. We had 6 in our party. It took a little bit to get a waitress to take our order but once she did she was attentive for the rest of the night. Beers were good and reasonably priced.  Why am I writing this review? Because this is the first place from Ballantyne South on Rea (that whole corridor including Blakeney and Weddington) that actually has a vibe worth going to check out. Can you open another in the Fountains (corner of Tom Short and Audrey Kell)? Hint: The Stadium just closed its doors for good. (and I do mean "for good"). I enjoyed it - I felt like it was a happening place. I didn't feel it was an exclusive crowd (like Cosmos at night). I felt all ages of adults could hang out and enjoy the place.    We didn't order food so I can't comment. It was nice to get some quality tap beers and to have OMB Amber for $3.50 a pint is a nice option as well.  Finally ! An owner who understands what a sports bar is supposed to be. Now if only they could open another location that I can walk to.

Gt-lhCZ1wk6v5RuHDOP7tQ.text: Gross, rude, unprofessional, and just, gross, food runner stuck her nose in a pre portioned side item 3 times before she decided to just stir it up and serve it anyway. If you question it, once, it's trash. Bartenders rude. Not worth the time.

xj1eg6MjgT4drEK5iqhG_A.text: 5 stars for unlimited $10 mimosas on Sundays with fresh orange juice. 5 stars for great service.   One star for the food. Great place to sit for a few drinks with friends. But don't plan to eat here. Too many other good choices in this complex.

5Sqsnkgr1ABZSeQJhQqeOA.text: Went here for lunch with the family. The service started out very fast. We were barely seated and they were asking for drink orders (that's too fast in my eyes). However, throughout the service things slowed down more than desired (the restaurant good busy).   My daughter got the chicken tenders, which were really good. However the fries had a odd flavor to them.   I ordered a French dip that was pretty good.   My wife ordered skillet melt without a bun. Unfortunately, we we received it there was now fried green tomato or aioli  we wanted this addressed, but our server didn't come by for another 30 minutes (see slow service above).   Lastly, my daughter asked for more lemonade which the server asked that we remove the lid and he'll come back and refill. That never occurred again because of the busy restaurant.    Overall, we likely will return only if we're in the area.

1a_tuZhG40WFeu9LBWr7NQ.text: I was excited to try this place since it's right down the street and nothing else like it is that close.  I really wanted to like it more but after our experience it was just a miss.  We arrived around 6:30 on a Saturday night.  The main reason they aren't getting a better rating from me is their wait system.  They ask for your phone number and when your table is ready they call you.  This is a big problem since the place is so loud and unless you are looking at your phone constantly, you are going to miss the call just like I did.  We had a party of 6 so this added an hour to the hour we had already been waiting, which is why I'm giving this rating.  I would advise them to invest in some pagers like other places or any other system that makes better sense than phone calls you can't hear.  We were also standing right in front of the hostess desk so it wouldn't have been hard for them to see the 6 of us and ask if we were such and such party.  They were also not very apologetic once I mentioned the issue to them.    When we finally did get seated our waitress was very nice and attentive and the food was decent but nothing to write home about.  As another reviewer posted, most of the tables are the high ones and only some of them have backs.  It was also very loud and I barely had a voice once we left.  I think this would be a decent place for a couple of people to go and have a drink and not interested in carrying on a conversation, but not sure I would go back for dinner.  There are other places in Ballantyne (sports bars) that I would go to before going here again.

nhait7oQP4jE0eTaD7dKRQ.text: Have you seen their latest health inspection results?! No wonder their food taste so weird. Not thanks. Waiters are rude- Owner is a joke. NEVER going back.

12RPqj2O2pQQSrXy56n0gw.text: Tried to have lunch here today.  Place was empty, and the bartender and server were rude and annoyed we were there.  Apparently, customer service is not a priority.  Tables were dirty, and when asking the server to clean, I got a shrug and eye roll.  We will never be back.  Suggest hiring some new staff.

BkEEWN5BQWXSCZM96-i9vA.text: Last night I tried the BSH honey chipotle wings (grilled) and they were amazing!!! A must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. BSH was packed last night. Awesome band!!!

k8m7UZF_d7wSPSatNvObvQ.text: Great music. Awesome happy hour! Best food ever!!! Highly recommend the cheese sticks!! Yummy! Lots of Tv's great service. Overall great vibe. Can't wait to go back again.

fse3IW6Hw0Uq0ebx85F2hg.text: Went in for lunch and the place was quiet save for a few tables.  Services was still slow regardless.  Draught beer selection was mediocre.    The reason for the 1 star review was the "industry standard burger" I ordered.  A 14 dollar bison burger that came cooked to the wrong temperature and was heavily salted to the point it was inedible.  The person I was dining with also had the same problem with their burger.  We didn't finish our meals ands sent both back.  To make the experience even less enjoyable the now rude waitress informed us that no salt had been added and the would not be comped, but hey we got 5 bucks back.  Of course it took 20 minutes to finally get the check and leave.  Will not return.  Save yourself the trouble and go to Duckworth`s instead better beer and food.

u7RTfxm2BMdtHtHWS5XXiA.text: I would like to say that my first experience was just a bad one.  We have been back a few times and I definitely think that a one star bump is in order.  This place is actually pretty cool.  The burgers are excellent and the people are so pleasant!  Upgraded!

KVgrXn905xkOMAHWPUXa2A.text: Two fails usually means that I do not return to a restaurant. First I had a dry flavorless "Ruben" sandwich then my wife had a grouper filet that could best described as inedible. I like the vibe, but with the exception of the burgers and the wings the food is not very good. I may return for a beer and a game, but not for dinner.

uZgVvWu_ljE58EBW1pAb3Q.text: This is a fun place in south Charlotte. Very fun atmosphere...the crowd is always friendly and jovial. A variety of beer selections. Their "bar food" is actually high quality, not nasty where everything tastes the same!

E7yoLRS3Q9HXg_GEz6spug.text: Ive never had the food here before. Only came here for drinks. Usually on the weekends they have a live band. It is very crowded on the weekends! I've seen so many people get bumped and drinks spilling on them. Patio area is ok if you wanna sit in smoke due to all the smokers.

NklHfwpiJQjuoG5pu5zMLg.text: If it weren't for the food, I'd scratch this place altogether. I'm all about the beer cheese and the stoopid hot sauce. It's close to work, so I enjoy being able to come grab food on my lunch break. The service sucks the majority of the time. I get it -it's slow - but if you have a table, I really recommend refilling drinks and asking how the food is before engaging in chatter with your coworkers & bouncing balls around.   We were one of two tables - the other table seemed to be somewhat attended to. We waited ten minutes to get water refilled and am currently waiting for my check. Funny how this place is less than a mile from my office but I can't see to squeeze in lunch without racing back to the office because my hour long break has only three minutes left.   Anyway, good beer cheese.

2AoZR3745guIEOoo308bSA.text: As a new place, I won't curse this joint with a 3, but it was like a 3.5 and we'll round up because it's local folks.  Located at Village at Robinson Farm just past the intersection of Rea Rd and Ballantyne Commons (same strip as The Meat House, Cosmos and Hawthorne's), this is definitely one-of-a-kind in the area for local places.  Lots of TV's, mostly high top tables and a large bar with LOTS of beer choices, this is a place for games and to hang out.  Finished concrete floors and high ceilings give this an unfinished vibe, but it's quite nice.  There is quite a bit of outdoor seating and 2 large roll-up doors for when it's not blazing hot out with summer storms rolling through.    If you have a fat ass, the low tables with metal chairs are not going to be comfortable (the chairs are comfy to sit in, but the arms will squeeze your booty).  The hostess tried to steer me to a high top table, which 80% of the restaurant is, but I had on a skirt and I hate high top tables.  They have a few booths as well, but those look like they are for larger parties, and I hate taking those up when it's just me.  For food, after looking at their menu on their Facebook page (they only opened up last week and their website is still under construction), I wanted the Skillet Melt, but the friendly, lovely young lady that was waiting on me said that was one of the 2 things they didn't have today (because that's how I roll).  I asked what she liked and she said the Prime Rib Dip ($11), so we went with that with a side of sweet potato fries.  I read somewhere, either on their FB page or one of the write-ups, that they use bread from Nova's Bakery - it's always nice to see locally sourced stuff on a menu.  The sammich was fine.  It was a little light on meat, the onions were cooked well on it, and the cheese was barely noticeable. The bread was good, but the way it is domed makes the middle of the sandwich thick with bread - so with the combo of little meat and thick bread, it was like I was eating a bread sandwich.  But the meat was flavored well.  The sweet potato fries were a little bigger than shoestring and were fine, again nothing unusual.    The restaurant itself is a very neat concept, well needed in this area.  Great execution.  There were a lot of smiling faces - the waitresses were lovely and there were a few young buff gentlemen pitching in as well, so everyone should be happy with the scenery.  If you are drinker, I am thinking you need to get over here ASAP to try it out.  I may have ordered the wrong thing, so I will be back to try it again once they are open for a bit and get in the groove.

photos.caption: Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Prime Rib Dip with sweet potato fries ($11)
Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Plenty of seating (or standing)
Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Less than 1/2 of the bar area - huge, great space with lots of TV&#39;s

ThagAkpi3AH-zosYTvQtag.text: After my most recent experience, I feel I need to update my review.  Unfortunately, this will most likely be my last review for Bradshaws, because I will probably never be back.   As my group was sitting outside, we witnessed someone get taken away in an ambulance. They either drank too much or got into a fight, I honestly have no idea what happened to them.  After we watched this person get taken away, one of the "victims" friends came to our table and go off on a person in our group.   Apparently she didn't like they were watching.  It was a pretty strange/awkward/unnerving situation.  I hadn't seen something like this since college, and this wasn't a college crowd. Security was required to remove this individual from our table. She wasn't kicked out and just moved to another spot in the bar, which was pretty close to us still and began to talk to others in bar about us. She may have been a regular, I don't know. Again, awkward. My wife and I left the bar immediately at this point.   Again, it's doubtful we will ever be back.    The food is solid and they have decent beers, but the majority of people that frequent the bar are very far from my preferred crowd.  No thanks.

NdzNWHOVLgYdycKqzZvtBw.text: Had ordered chicken wings for the Thursday night Panther Game... I'm sure there was more grease in my to go container than there was left in the fryer ! It was awful....even the celery and carrots were soaked.......ewwwwwwwwwww. Usually love their food but this was the 2nd time we experienced the same issue......

sSeKqsG6EU_JecseJ_80nA.text: Typical bar atmosphere with not so typical menu. Order the Fried pickles and they came with a sauce so thin and watery and it didn't cling to the pickles, which were so salty, I felt my ankles expand as I ate them. I asked for a different sauce, but that was thin too. The Turkey with avocado was so blend and tasteless, dry as my hair, and in desperate need of some kind of sauce to hide the earthy taste of the sprouts on it. My Asian sesame salad was boring, and not a sesame seed in sight, as it says on menu. The dressing was typical Asian, almost teriyaki-ish and salty as hell, which now started the swelling of my fingers. I miss the usual bar menu of chicken fingers and mozzarella sticks.  Bars should stick to the tried and True unless you've mastered the menu outside the box. This is one of those bars.

lHtMyHVa40JtEnGwzohyvQ.text: It's a bar. Good for drinks. Do not eat the food. Most appetizers were fried, tasted old or just gross. Maybe that's why they were half off?  And the ciabatta burger had just regular toast as the bread and undercooked meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fries with bacon and cheese(?)
Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheesesteak egg rolls
Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garlic parmesan wings

fXJMycaHPCkwpVUkP2oUhg.text: So I've been here too many times to count and this is my review: food: food is 3 stars on a good day.. This place is not about food, that is why it's hard to review. I have come to know our few important great staff, bouncers and other Bradshaw's go-ers and it becomes that 'cheers' kind of hang out where you start knowing everybody. They will look out for you, and the bouncers always have everything so under control I don't think twice about being there by myself.  This place on a Wednesday, Thursday for live band kareoke, Friday or Saturday night with honestly fantastic live music, I'm talking after 9, 10 pm turns into an awesome night club atmosphere for the over 30+(Might be more toward 40+) crowd. We dance all night, and on those nights, this place is a 12!!! . I love the energy of the people here.. that's my review!! Thanks Bradshaws for giving us older folks somewhere to shake it close to home!

photos.caption: Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken wings, one with absolutely no meat.
Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Typical Wednesday, Friday or Saturday with live music!

PEFWtNtWTyInt-YJhp5Y4A.text: Review is solely for the food. If you want a good brew, then this place is ok but def don't order the food. I ordered the pretzel bites with beer cheese and it was horrible. The pretzel was obviously warmed up in the microwave and tasted a week old. I will not be going back for any type of food. Wait staff so super awesome and friendly.  If you want a good pretzel and beer cheese, head to Old Mecklenburg  Brewery. None better!!!

ndkqY7Hr8tim0pCZrzYXPw.text: Pretty good food and beer selection on tap. I had the parmesan fries and a cheesesteak, and both were delicious!

Xl6I7O3KqR8WBBOsRZUo0w.text: Pro: Good bands, always see familiar faces. Cons: one female bartender always over the top rude, snobby staff, they over serve their patrons and then kick them out when clock strikes two as they wait for their cab. Call police on people that show up to serve as DD's assuming they're drunk as well...all of the above has happened quite a few times to me and folks I talk to. Avoid.

CMWqfDAHR1phQuDl8FVXzw.text: Terrible. Just Terrible.   Awful service. Comically horrible band. Way too many TVs. Music too loud and dumb.   Solid beer selection though

FjYNU47oRXXnW0sIc_7kFw.text: Ok - bottom line ... As previously noted - horrible customer service / wait staff attitudes suck - food nothing to come back for.... What with the bartenders attitudes ??? As a previous bartender, here's a tip : smile / be attentive/ converse with those that seem to need a friend- and guess what ?? Your tips will improve and you might enjoy your job ?!!  Cannot believe "owners" allow such a prime location (nothing else close) to be dragged to this level. But - Attitude derived from the top .... Just sayin.

CU3YN0V-BHNQxwo_syqu5w.text: Thank you Bradshaw Social House for keeping the Ballantyne area fun! The bartenders and servers are always polite and attentive, which is hard to find in the service industry today. I love the live music and karaoke they do throughout the week! Food is delicious and consistent! Keep up the great work BSH!!

U8mff76P22Z0yUPcrcxZJw.text: We went to lunch here and I have got to say, it was pretty gross. I ordered the asian chicken salad with shrimp. It was literally a handful of lettuce with 5 shrimp on top. They were rubbery and tasted old. We also ordered the kids fish and chips for our toddler. It was gross as well. The fries tasted like they were cooked several hours before and and had a weird after taste. Everything was pretty bad - like - didn't want to pay for it, it was so bad.  With that begin said, it IS a bar. And we didn't exactly order 'bar food'. The Mister ate here before and got a burger and said it was great...so I don't know. I don't think I'll ever order food here again!

i7hOaH2R68jloaGSqMRFFw.text: This is a good place to meet somebody because there are a lot of girls here. The food is fine for a bar place. Parking can be less than adequate.

idBqZP17h0e8kFKdzMkrwg.text: Great atmosphere for football.. servers are great! What I would suggest is to not beer batter the green tomatoes and to use an actual spring roll wrap for the philly cheesesteak spring rolls not egg roll wraps.. The gouda bites smaller and denser cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States

tojvx_ic-PRWOAYGiLx9Bw.text: This place is cougariffic. I mean packed on weekends with live music and a great crowd. On a Saturday night with NFL playoffs on it was very hard to move around inside but hey have a lot of bar staff around to help make sure you get your drinks. Plenty of room outside with good spillover. The doors roll up to the outside on good weather evenings. Whether you want a domestic beer or a local microbrew you should be able to get your favorite it if you can make it to the bar. The busiest bar in Ballantyne by a long shot and that means fun if you know what you are looking for.

pGUsqEZxkubQ7q7Z23X7Tw.text: Waaaaay too much attitude from the female bartenders here. You are a bartender at a bar in south Charlotte. Get over yourself. P.S. Sincerest of apologies  that I prefer my beer to have a head that measures less than 12 inches.

KSGPjt-poZqbpUlMpxMqpA.text: Tried out this new and already very popular restaurant last Friday. We went in early-ish  (6 to me is early) and found the place packed. We got the last seats in the house before they went on a wait.  As others have noted, there are a lot of tall tops, but we sat at one of the few tables behind the wall at the entrance. I will agree that any of us who find we carry weight in our hips/thighs could find these seats pretty uncomfortable. I was good to go, thankfully, but I can see where if I were up just another size or two it would be painful, and that would be embarrassing. I wonder how long they'll keep those chairs.  Our server was incredibly attentive, professional and helpful. Five stars for service. I didn't see anyone wanting/waiting for anything while we were there.  The food was okay. Not fantastic, but it's a bar essentially, so you get decent quality bar food. As it was still Happy Hour we ordered half price appetizers - chips and salsa and hummus. The chips and salsa were just sad. A tiny cup of salsa, and a handful or so of chips on a plate. Not worth the money, even at half price, certainly nothing special. The hummus was delicious and served with pita, carrots and celery.  My husband ordered the steak tips, and was disappointed by the blandness of the rice. It would be better served with mashed potatoes rather than just a formed mound of white rice with no flavor. (I don't like rice, to me it has no flavor anyway, but my husband fixes and devours a lot of it and even he pronounced it "incredibly bland" as he reached for the salt shaker.)   Oh, a word about the shakers... Pour the salt in your hands first. They have a ton of holes and you'll get a bucket of salt dumped on your meal if you just shake from it.  I tried the fish sandwich and pretty much just ate it like fish and chips, because it was less food and cheaper than the fish and chips and I didn't have a huge appetite after the appetizers. My meal was solid.  The biggest problem we have with this restaurant is visiting during the heat of the summer. It was 85+ degrees outside, and with that awesome cool garage door set up opened, it was very hot and stuffy inside. There were no fans anywhere near our tables. I saw one small set of fans over the bar area, but that's it.   Here in Charlotte, in the summer, you can either go for cool air conditioning or sweltering "ambiance" you can't have both. They need to keep that door closed and the restaurant air conditioned in the summer.  It sounds like I hate this place. Really, I don't. The restaurant is new, but it has great potential. Clearly they hired good servers, and they're trying this whole menu for the first time so I'm sure there will be changes.  We will be back to BSH sometime, but with those garage doors and the heat issues inside the restaurant, we probably won't return until the fall.

D0xxwUyIV9C03lYrjzVhgA.text: This place is so blah with awful drinks even when I tried to play it safe I had the worst tasting wine. If it wasn't for it's convenient location and one friend I would not even consider going there.. not my cup of tea

ya1igp6mYhwGx3mIda6pMQ.text: Not the best place for dining and the beer choices aren't that great considering it's in Charlotte of all places (beer Mecca). Even the wings have hardly any flavor . Bleh

OiS5FZnMR9Czg2E72kYmsQ.text: This review is for the food only. I really enjoyed their veggie burger! Super flavorful with great texture. Not just a morning star patty from the grocery, which is what most places provide. I paired this with ranch and Mac and cheese.  The crowd is not my type. Lots of d-bag guys, & Cougars... But hey that may be your scene, but it's not mine. Guys should not take selfies, especially in public places (Period)

photos.caption: Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States

JlLwdKfjb9yIw5vzGY7Rag.text: I've been really disappointed with my last couple visits here. I was so excited to show my friend who just moved to the area this place as I really liked it. The last time I brought her we sat ourselves, were given menus and the waiter came up right away and kind of grunted at us "what do you want?". It was obviously off-putting and I asked for a minute with the drink menu and he pointed at the menu in front of us. When he came back he seemed to be slightly more enthusiastic. I tried to ordered the blended drink on the menu but he said the blender was broken which everyone knows means nobody feels like washing the blender. I ordered a well drink and my friend ordered the mule. The menu says it comes in a copper mug but he brought it in glass. When asked why the waiter told us they stopped using them because they were getting stolen. The menu also had a bunch of fall beers listed in the draft list but it was May. Checking out took a really long time too. Something else that bothers me about this place is that nobody ever writes down your order and we've had mistakes in the past. Very disappointing :( it feels like literally nobody in there cares.

x2xRi6Jwhv-xHYDgUvF8OA.text: I went to Bradshaw this Saturday with my friends and we had a very bad experience the owner was very rude the whole place looks like they didn't have any one running the place, we waited 20 minutes for the beers and then we look at the patio and we saw some people fighting, so we will never go back to that place again.

uqh-AepWtTdn8hABZPLdhA.text: Ear splitting NOISE!!  Sunday, 5:00. The Panther game was over!  the sound was so Loud for whatever football was on (that most people were not watching).  We had to leave.   No one was talking to each other because they could not hear the person next to them.  the DJ must be Deaf!!  then during commercials, loud music. Sorry, sports do not have to blow your ears out. Downed a beer and left. Will never go back.  Food?  how could anyone eat?

VO5UYRAoHY9OInlJVOrQjw.text: One of the best places to come to! Come if you're trying to have a good time. There's wings 1/2 off on Tuesdays and trivia with a free bucket of beer as a prize! Burgers with a side for $5 on Wednesday and 1/2 off wine bottles. People super genuine and nice. Especially the best part being LIVE BANDS! So much going on you can't miss out

JmouvUZOvXv4bVDY7ZSB4Q.text: Service was subpar which is unusual. While waiting for two bottles of beer and one draft (for almost ten minutes) we watched our server do her side work, chat and with staff, and deliver multiple different drink orders to the same table. After she FINALLY came by our table to apologize for the bartenders lack of efficiency, we watched her whisper to staff (assuming that she said she forgot to ring in our drinks). it was only after I explained that I had a crazy day and ordered a bucket of beer, as to assure I wouldn't wait for a drink again, did she bring us our previously ordered drinks and bucket at the same time. Get it together Bradshaw's, get it together.   A regular that may be less regular

4MxneKB0X3XEeQULtZteKQ.text: My wife and I went in for dinner and drinks on a Friday night around 6:30. This place has a great atmosphere with plenty of tv's and a cool industrial feel. We decided to sit at the bar as there was plenty of room and was promptly greeted and served by Perri. Awesome service by the way and she was very knowledgeable and gave great recommendations on food and drinks. Our food was excellent and we definitely got our money's worth!      Now comes the beer! HUGE disappointment! While they have a great selection of draft beer, their tap or cooling system needs some major work. Beer was barely cold and on the verge of being room temperature. I saw this on a previous review and thought surely Bradshaw social would have addressed that issue but obviously not.       Cold beer would have given this place 4 stars, possibly 5. Please get this fixed so we may return and enjoy your restaurant again.

7UDxwuKoCDOCiDHlgyL4Sw.text: Been here a bunch but never reviewed. I felt compelled to this time for the lousy service. When we got in nobody was seating and someone eventually told us to sit wherever we wanted. So we picked a table and got comfy, our server came over and gave us menus but never wiped the table down(it needed it). After at least a ten minute wait she took our order. Twenty minutes later she brought our appetizer out. We could see our main order was up but she decided to wait so we could enjoy our barely warm fried pickles. We had to flag down another server to get our drinks refilled. So another ten minutes go by and she brings our food over which also was barely warm. Fries got soggy and were not eatable. We could see her most of the time with her face buried in her phone. It was the middle of the day and they were not busy. We probably won't be back after the lackluster service.

ns3D2v__QBT9sqMml42M6A.text: Good local bar with entertainment nightly and food specials. Wednesday is burger night and all of their burgers expect the brisket burger (of course) is just $5! They don't skimp on portions either. Plenty of fresh house cut fries and the buns are from a local bakery. Decent beer selection on tap featuring local micro brews and the servers were all very friendly. They could've been a bit more attentive but they were really friendly. I'd recommend this place.  Trivia on Tuesday and live music on Wednesdays according the bar tender.

UW3VwVWHDJpvqKyEyvPvZg.text: OMG! The Smoked Jalapenos, wrapped in #bacon, stuffed with pulled pork and cheddar cheese is absolute Heaven-on-Earth! These poppers are everything!  #JaisFavoriteThings

NcCys7dU0eIkbdqG6RxCoQ.text: One of the worst place I ever been the owner is very rude no class at all, I took some friends there last weekend and one of my friend start talking to one girl then the owner came really upset and told him he needed to leave the bar, then my friend asked him why and he replied I'm the owner so I don't own you any explanation just leave, so my friend told him you know how much money we expend? $300 he said he didn't care well I told my friend let's go, we will never recommend that place again.

P6cZdHVYrX6_kzZbBkuXfA.text: Overall, not a bad joint for south Charlotte  Came to watch the NBA playoffs and to root for the Charlotte Hornets. Had no problem finding a seat on a hopping Friday night. The waitress, Rachel, was very polite and accommodating to turn on the game prior to tip off. Comfortable seats. Nice TV angles from any location.  We ordered the barbecue wings bourbon style. They had a nice char on them. The french fries were average. The nachos could've used more toppings, very little salsa and lettuce and tomato.  They had decent beer specials. Running about $2.50 for cans, and $3.50 for local drafts The pretzel bread had good cheese, but the bread itself was only ordinary.  There was a band scheduled to play at 10 PM, but nice to see the management decided to complete the Hornets game prior to letting them start up.  I know the reviews here were hit or mess. This is a nice unique place if you want a break from Hickory Tavern or other said sports bars. It's  more of an upscale crowd I would say. A lot of cougars coming in after 10 PM.

wcXD1a4DmQeDQEtydP3fAA.text: We have been patrons of Bradshaw's since it opened, and love the staff.  We went last night and left earlier than we had planned because a table of guys were vaping.  Smokers have to go outside of the main bar, so why is vaping allowed?  It smelled and was causing some people to sneeze and cough.  I watched four tables leave before we did.   I will go back if this changes, but I'd rather spend my time and money at places where I can breathe.  PS, the staff doesn't like it either.

GwrzYyyLFjiIPuHi-YHOAg.text: Stopped in for a drink around 9PM on our way home from dinner. The bouncer stopped us at the door and scanned our drivers licenses explaining to us this was a private club and we needed a membership to enter. He handed us free membership cards explaining next time to show it as we entered. The bar looked very nice, we had one drink and left. We were put off by an establishment taking our information, wonder who they will sell it to.

fnCrf_O_YHL-G0LKhdyl0Q.text: We begrudgingly tried BSH again since Lure isn't open on Mondays. Appetizers were half off til 7:00, so we split the fried green tomatoes and quesedillas. I honestly couldn't tell much difference between the two; they were just so.. bland. We then ordered the pretzels with beer cheese because how could you mess that up? Congeal the cheese, that's how.  As we left at 7:30, they were setting up for live music. We were the youngest people in there by a good 10 years, and we're in our mid-30s, so I'd say it's a big of an older, cougar-ish clientele, at least on a Monday night. At least our service was good.  I've given it the old college try, but I'm done trying.

NqPkC021ohi2MvUrujMy9w.text: If it wasn't for the bartender acting bothered that we came in on a very slow afternoon (there were maybe 10 people in the place) I would give more stars. I like the atmosphere - great place to hang out with friends, watch games. Bartendress was busy unloading a shipment that was dropped off and chatting with other staff who seemed to be off duty. Had to wait and wait for her to come around our side of the bar after the food was dropped to request a couple items. Really no excuse for poor service and an attitude to boot. Hopefully management reads the many reviews echoing this sentiment and cleans house a bit.   The food was unimpressive. I had a "quinoa" veggie burger that is reportedly made in-house. I couldn't identify any quinoa in it, but rather it had the texture of a bean burger - mushy and cat food-like. Fries are amazing - hand cut, cooked perfectly. Hubs had chicken wings finished on the grill. He said not bad, but wasn't raving.  There was nobody on the patio, as it was mid afternoon and cold outside, so I can't speak to that. What I've read says they allow smoking out there so that would be a no-go for me. It's a pet peeve having lived in Las Vegas most of my life when bars/restaurants in other States allow smoking anywhere near the establishment. Personally,I find the smell extremely offensive and do not wish to be subjected to smoke in order to enjoy the outdoors. I can't think of any reason why smokers can't have a designated smoking area away from patrons who are drinking and eating and trying to breath oxygen. I guess places like this are hoping to attract smokers? Maybe they drink more? Idk.

RGxPh9cDu4dexgb49us_hQ.text: I am a little late in posting but they took care of my hubbys surprise party on July 12th . Everything was amazing down to the food they chose to serve ! The service was great ! Didn't care for the band that night it was a 2 pc ensemble but otherwise everything was awesome ! Thanks guys !!!

eFbkcOdtukcKPHuevp1Pxw.text: Excellent service for our first visit. From the moment we arrived the bouncer checking ID helped us choose a table and noticed our seat of choice needed a bit of cleaning. He didn't wait for someone else he took the initiative to clean it himself.  Our waitress was equally attentive providing solid recommendations. We had the dozen wings (typical bar food that tasted just fine) / cheese steak egg rolls (first time I has them anywhere and loved it. It has a nice balance of cheese and meat wrapped by the standard egg roll wrap) / Ribs were amazing! Our waitress described it as a specialty since the chefs used to own a BBQ place. I can see why she called it out.  I will certainly come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot and &#34;Stoopid&#34; Hot Wings
Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheese Steak Egg Rolls
Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Full rack of ribs with green beans and rice

39xQOA8ykTBaV7T3hujp9A.text: Great place, great music! Wednesday's through the weekend has specials. Food is great and atmosphere even better. Live music was great! Try the burgers and wings. Great place, fun atmosphere!!

5N5qwAicc-cfm-HnGVbr8w.text: This is one of those places that charges $2 extra for ice in your drink. What a crock of shit. Don't even bother.  We did have a great server though.

-4Ne1qdJxbD8a41tt0WDbg.text: As a restaurant manager... I would never step foot back in this establishment. The children's beverages came after bar drinks. The "no tomato with an allergy" was ignored... Macaroni side was hard and cold. All of these things were pushed aside because as restaurant managers we understand that things do happen especially with a later crowd. But in 15 years of the industry I have never been disappointed enough to write a bad review....   Ashley, the manager, so I was told did not leave behind the bar. Liz... Our server... Should not be. And i fully regret the tip we left her. She brought our tab which I gave her a debit card for... 20 dollar cash tip which I informed her the cash was hers and the card was for the tip. Our friends decided to have one more beer and I kindly asked if we could have one beer and one shot seperate from the prior transaction and gave her a 20. She tried to keep 40 and charged our card 78...   As a manager... I fully understand confusions... Stupid comps... If you're in the weeds... If you just don't know. Or if you had given even half of an apology when we asked about our check once you attempted to pocket 40 dollars on a 78 dollar check... Which should not have even been 78 on the card. If you were a decent honest employee... Our table would have easily left you 100 percent of the bill altogether. We still left 50 percent and we should not have.   Also... I'm sure your managers are fully aware that the 5 of us will tell how awful our experience was tonight... And everyone we tell... will tell multiple other people. So there will be 2 restaurants with 80 plus employees and 5 guests of your restaurant that will not step foot in there because you have one employee who tried to pocket 40 dollars when she was already tipped 20 on a 67 dollar check and 17 on a 60 dollar check...

2KfRt13L3MrNFLW86b40Ng.text: Great little neighborhood spot. Burgers are delicious and in Wednesday's only $5 and that includes a side. Louder than most places but it had a cool vibe. Nice selection of local brews. Service was on point. Will definitely return.

L0seaKa3q03F8HySUgm0Vg.text: I just love this place... ambience is great and you'll fall for the servers. They have really good deals like half price wings Tuesday (W Trivia), $5 burgers Wednesday, live band karaoke Thursday... great live music. Average age of costumers 35/45

photos.caption: Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar area
Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dinning area

KDLzN2zyv9OrV56yJZkRHQ.text: Wings and Chili cheese fries were great for me and my boy.  Nice and crisp.  Staff very friendly.    Who decides its a good idea to turn on Margaritaville during commercials of the Carolina game when while the majority of patrons are trying to take in their game.  I guess they do that to  drowned out the boo hoos of Panther fans.    What ever the reason how bout keeping the music off during the games on football Sunday.

gOARHqGNjXETUDeypZ6e1Q.text: Fries are good. Burgers and other mainstays, okay. Bartenders are nice. Wings, okay, except for their Barbalo which are above average. Beer taps need a good cleaning, you can taste the lack of care. Salsa is made fresh, which is a good sign, but it's not very good... trying to be something more than simple. The main problem.. I've been 3 times and the same group of older guys are there at the bar (patrons) and if you're within an earshot, one or all of them will make comments about what you're ordering or eating or watching, etc. I didn't go to the bathroom because I thought one of them would ask me how it went. I'm not kidding. They mean no harm, but jeez, they take "social house" to an all-time annoying level. This is not the place to go for a quick, decent meal and a drink. It's trying too hard versus just doing the basics extremely well. And, tell those guys at the bar to quit it.

ZFHjltGDzhTUri2Thrx5Mw.text: I went to Bradshaw's on two occasions on a Friday between 4-6 with coworkers. I went on my own and was greeted at the door by someone saying some BS about are you a member.  Bradshaw's I was born yesterday you can stick your so called membership where the sun doesn't shine. I saw two others walk in and not get questioned.

T4Z16t-3DQ3nXcrDzhbDAw.text: First off let me be clear by saying my 1 star rating is purely based on my interaction with the staff at the front door. I live very close to Bradshaw's so it was the logical choice when my cousin and I wanted to meet up for a few drinks. I was highly upset that they took my drivers license and scanned it for "whatever reason". Then they asked us for my email address & phone number.   We politely rejected in giving that info so they said it would be a $2.00 cover charge. I was like WTF! All we wanted to do is go to the bar to drink but they would not let us enter. It's really not the $2.00,  Now I had been to this spot at least 2 times prior a year or so ago. I mean The food is good and the atmosphere is cool too but it just really freakin bothered me that they would turn away 2 dudes who were going to run up a decent tab at the bar for failure to give personal information.

OsxNHfDrdEWvC6jce1hfYg.text: The waitress was great. Very attentive and polite and busy. The place was very loud and had so many games on that it was distracting and hard to focus on the game I came to watch. They also had the "garage door" wall open. It was freezing unless you were sitting far away from it. My sandwich was good but the tater tots were insanely salty. I'm talking about a side of salt with a hint of tater tot. I was wiping them off with my napkin and they were still all salt. They were AWFUL and tater tots aren't supposed to be awful. The "chairs" were pretty bad too. Cold metal with the shortest "back".  It'd be better if they were just backless barstools.

n9JI41Wl9Al9IZZ2D2yhyA.text: Chicken Wings for the Win!!! Fantastic wings, with fantastic sauces and huge portions for your money! Tuesday night is half price wings so you get 12 wings for $7 and they are the bomb! I think just as in most pub style restaurants, the service is mediocre but c'mon, just try not to expect too much and enjoy their delicious greasy food and beer and watch your soccer game. I think this place has so many bad reviews because it's in Ballantyne and y'all expect fine dining service with pub prices. Sometimes you just gotta humble yourself and enjoy the flavor without the fuss..You can't expect Chick-fil-a service at McDonald's right?  Right! So order your cheesey fries, bacon burger and carolina dijon wings -- enjoy their greasy goodness and who cares if the waitress brought you blue cheese instead of ranch... you'll live!

vEfijuP3q1nAuTP-uGz89g.text: Dropped in for the first time for an early meal with my wife. Great ribs, sweet potato fries, and zucchini. The service was awesome.  Bridget was a great server and took care of us.

Ul3E5H3sGvvP9NSGDcaP5A.text: Attempted to visit this place for the first time tonight and like many places in the area it was slow, so we walked in and the racist black bouncer chased us down to get our IDs and he scanned them.  When I asked where is my information from my drivers licenses is being saved, Instead of giving a professional answer, the over zealous bouncer said "In our system, you're white ass doesn't have to visit here, bye". First & last attempt to visit a failing bar.

sVBPJ5rf3mpkmkQDDUpXzg.text: Greasy is the best thing to say about this place. The cheesesteak spring rolls were in an egg roll wrapper. The onion rings were in a thick beer batter that was more batter than onion.  I can forgive the waitress but to be the last to be serve was not a start. Not including forgetting my water.  Overall I do not plan to come here unless I am brought by others and not eating anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheesesteak egg roll.
Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Onion rings with more batter than onion.

7jZVysXa3Fcl3KZhyi6rBw.text: The minute I walked in things were just not right. The hostess was sitting with her feet up eating some type of food out of a Tupperware bowl. When she finally acknowledged me I asked if she seated people or I just choose a seat, she said yeah. The waitress finally arrived she was nice enough and busy with multiple tables. then in the middle of eating my meal some woman comes up apparently that works there and asked me if I would mind moving!are you kidding me i am in the middle of my meal, i am eating at a 2 person table with 1 chair. are u kidding me!!! only good thing was food was decent and waitress was nice.

nIVkl3l_fGKXsOBozEHuiA.text: The female blonde bartender tonight is pathetic.  Won't look up. Try to get service. Forget about it.  Seriously dj loud during commercials.

6sohISznhjcrj8mgrruM8w.text: I live right down the street and would love to go to Bradshaws for convenience but the food selection is so bad and mixed drinks always taste bad I never go anymore. Too many times being disappointed and saying to myself "never again". There aren't any healthy options, no decent salads, just greasy bar food. There isn't even any pasta. I get beer to be safe because the drinks always taste weird and like they weren't made right. They have good bands though so that keeps people coming in spite of the food/drinks.

1Ip_bISusFYxHBr8RBy1EQ.text: THE CROSSFIT BURGER. A good choice if you are watching your carb intake. This was a nice sized burger with bacon and avocado and of course lettuce. I'm not usually one to enjoy fries, but they were very good, a perfect flavor!   If I ever come back I will be sure to come on a Wednesday for the $5 burgers!  Expect it to be crowded if you go during the evening, but our server still did a good job with serving us in a timely manner.

photos.caption: Photo of Bradshaw Social House - Charlotte, NC, United States

BzjTGTjMDnp41djR_C8xvg.text: I carry out from this establishment at least once a week for the past year. It is conservative to say that over 50% of the time the food I order is not what I get. Just recently I ordered a cheeseburger with tots and an order of fried wings with stupid hot sauce on the side with blue cheese. A few minutes after I gave this order I added mushrooms on the side. What I got, when I opened the food at home was a burger with tots and fried wings. No stupid hot sauce, no blue cheese, no celery which comes automatically. Not sure what the hell happens between the order, the kitchen and the bartender's delivery of the order, but validating order fulfillment is not part of the process. I'm sure I am not alone with this scenario. Spend a few bucks hire someone quality check the orders for heaven's sake.

fazn010Q-ZDf2mUaW3LlHw.text: Decent "bar" in the Blakeney area. It's considered a cougar "bar" and it varies on the crowd from night to night. If you go here enough you will see the same people over and over again which IMHO is annoying. Good staff and bartenders. All are polite and nice.
